# Rettangoli
> Rettangoli is a frontend library suite for building, styling, documenting, and visually testing web applications.

This file is a curated index for LLM-based tools. Prefer linked docs over guessing behavior.

## Projects
- **Rettangoli FE**: Schema-driven app layer with component architecture, handlers, store/actions, and view data flow.
- **Rettangoli UI**: Web component and primitive library with tokenized styling and responsive behavior.
- **Rettangoli VT**: Visual testing runner for capture, compare, reporting, and CI-friendly workflows.
- **Rettangoli Sites**: Markdown-first documentation/site generator used to build structured docs portals.

## Core Docs
- https://rettangoli.dev/fe/docs/introduction/introduction.md
- https://rettangoli.dev/fe/docs/introduction/getting-started.md
- https://rettangoli.dev/ui/docs/introduction/introduction.md
- https://rettangoli.dev/ui/docs/introduction/getting-started.md
- https://rettangoli.dev/vt/docs/introduction/quickstart.md
- https://rettangoli.dev/sites/docs/introduction/introduction.md
- https://rettangoli.dev/sites/docs/introduction/getting-started.md

- https://rettangoli.dev/sites/docs/reference/configuration.md
- https://rettangoli.dev/sites/docs/reference/markdown-and-frontmatter.md

## Notes
- UI docs describe current attribute names and behavior; treat those as source of truth for component usage.
- VT docs define capture/report workflow, config contract, and step action semantics.
- FE docs define schema, handlers, state flow, and architecture conventions.
